project.name: gridster.js
project.description: gridster.js, a drag-and-drop multi-column jQuery grid plugin

Collision.name: Collision
Collision.description:
Detects collisions between a DOM element against other DOM elements or
Coords objects.

params.name: el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement.

params.name: colliders
params.description:
Can be a jQuery collection
 of HTMLElements or an Array of Coords instances.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: overlapping_region
props.description:
Determines when collision
   is valid, depending on the overlapped area. Values can be: 'N', 'S',
   'W', 'E', 'C' or 'all'. Default is 'C'.

props.name: on_overlap_start
props.description:
Executes a function the first
   time each `collider ` is overlapped.

props.name: on_overlap_stop
props.description:
Executes a function when a
   `collider` is no longer collided.

props.name: on_overlap
props.description:
Executes a function when the
mouse is moved during the collision.

return.description: Collision instance.

Coords.name: Coords
Coords.description:
Creates objects with coordinates (x1, y1, x2, y2, cx, cy, width, height)
to simulate DOM elements on the screen.
Coords is used by Gridster to create a faux grid with any DOM element can
collide.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The jQuery HTMLElement or a object with: left,
top, width and height properties.

return.description: Coords instance.

Draggable.name: Draggable
Draggable.description:
Basic drag implementation for DOM elements inside a container.
Provide start/stop/drag callbacks.

params.name: el
params.description:
The HTMLelement that contains all the widgets
 to be dragged.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: items
props.description:
Define who will
    be the draggable items. Can be a CSS Selector String or a
    collection of HTMLElements.

props.name: distance
props.description:
Distance in pixels after mousedown
    the mouse must move before dragging should start.

props.name: limit
props.description:
Constrains dragging to the width of
    the container

props.name: offset_left
props.description:
Offset added to the item
    that is being dragged.

props.name: drag
props.description:
Executes a callback when the mouse is
    moved during the dragging.

props.name: start
props.description:
Executes a callback when the drag
    starts.

props.name: stop
props.description: Executes a callback when the drag stops.

params.name:
[options.ignore_dragging] Array of node names
     that sould not trigger dragging, by default is `['INPUT', 'TEXTAREA',
     'SELECT', 'BUTTON']
params.description: `. If a function is used return true to ignore dragging.

return.description: Returns `el`.

params.name: el
params.description: The HTMLelement that contains all the widgets.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: widget_selector
props.description:
Define who will
           be the draggable widgets. Can be a CSS Selector String or a
           collection of HTMLElements

props.name: widget_margins
props.description:
Margin between widgets.
           The first index for the horizontal margin (left, right) and
           the second for the vertical margin (top, bottom).

props.name: widget_base_dimensions
props.description:
Base widget dimensions
           in pixels. The first index for the width and the second for the
           height.

props.name: extra_cols
props.description:
Add more columns in addition to
           those that have been calculated.

props.name: extra_rows
props.description:
Add more rows in addition to
           those that have been calculated.

props.name: min_cols
props.description: The minimum required columns.

props.name: max_cols
props.description:
The maximum columns possible (set to null
           for no maximum).

props.name: min_rows
props.description: The minimum required rows.

props.name: avoid_overlapped_widgets
props.description:
Avoid that widgets loaded
           from the DOM can be overlapped. It is helpful if the positions were
           bad stored in the database or if there was any conflict.

props.name: auto_init
props.description:
Automatically call gridster init
           method or not when the plugin is instantiated.

props.name: serialize_params
props.description:
Return the data you want
           for each widget in the serialization. Two arguments are passed:
           `$w`: the jQuery wrapped HTMLElement, and `wgd`: the grid
           coords object (`col`, `row`, `size_x`, `size_y`).

props.name: collision
props.description:
An Object with all options for
           Collision class you want to overwrite. See Collision docs for
           more info.

props.name: draggable
props.description:
An Object with all options for
           Draggable class you want to overwrite. See Draggable docs for more
           info.

props.name: ignore_dragging
props.description:
Note that
                   if you use a Function, and resize is enabled, you should ignore the
                   resize handlers manually (options.resize.handle_class).

props.name: resize
props.description: An Object with resize config options.

props.name: enabled
props.description:
Set to true to enable
                   resizing.

props.name: handle_append_to
props.description:
Set a valid CSS
                   selector to append resize handles to.

props.name: handle_class
props.description:
CSS class name used
                   by resize handles.

props.name: start
props.description:
Function executed
                   when resizing starts.

props.name: resize
props.description:
Function executed
                   during the resizing.

props.name: stop
props.description:
Function executed
                   when resizing stops.

params.name:
[options.autogenerate_stylesheet] If true, all the
           CSS required to position all widgets in their respective columns
           and rows will be generated automatically and injected to the
           `<head>` of the document. You can set this to false, and write
           your own CSS targeting rows and cols via data-attributes like so:
           `[data-col="1"]
params.description: { left: 10px; }`

params.name:
[options.resize.axes] Axes in which widgets can be
                   resized. Possible values: ['x', 'y', 'both']

[options.resize.max_size] Limit widget dimensions
                   when resizing. Array values should be integers:
                   `[max_cols_occupied, max_rows_occupied]

[options.resize.min_size] Limit widget dimensions
                   when resizing. Array values should be integers:
                   `[min_cols_occupied, min_rows_occupied]

classitems.description: Convert properties to Integer

params.name: obj
params.description: - config object to be converted

return.description: Returns the converted object.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in ascending way.
classitems.name: sort_by_row_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) placing first the empty cells upper left.
classitems.name: sort_by_row_and_col_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects by column (representing the grid
coords of each widget) in ascending way.
classitems.name: sort_by_col_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in descending way.
classitems.name: sort_by_row_desc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description: Disables dragging.
classitems.name: disable

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Enables dragging.
classitems.name: enable

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Disables drag-and-drop widget resizing.
classitems.name: disable

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Enables drag-and-drop widget resizing.
classitems.name: enable

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Add a new widget to the grid.
classitems.name: add_widget

params.name: html
params.description:
The string representing the HTML of the widget
 or the HTMLElement.

params.name: size_x
params.description: The nº of rows the widget occupies horizontally.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The nº of columns the widget occupies vertically.

params.name: col
params.description: The column the widget should start in.

params.name: row
params.description: The row the widget should start in.

params.name: max_size
params.description: max_size Maximun size (in units) for width and height.

params.name: min_size
params.description: min_size Minimum size (in units) for width and height.

return.description:
Returns the jQuery wrapped HTMLElement representing.
 the widget that was just created.

classitems.description: Change widget size limits.
classitems.name: set_widget_min_size

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget or an index representing the desired widget.

params.name: min_size
params.description: Minimum size (in units) for width and height.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Change widget size limits.
classitems.name: set_widget_max_size

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget or an index representing the desired widget.

params.name: max_size
params.description: Maximun size (in units) for width and height.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Append the resize handle into a widget.
classitems.name:
add_resize_handle
 representing the widget.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description: Change the size of a widget. Width is limited to the current grid width.
classitems.name: resize_widget

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget.

params.name: size_x
params.description: The number of columns that will occupy the widget. By default size_x is limited to the space available from the column where the widget begins, until the last column to the right.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The number of rows that will occupy the widget.

params.name: reposition
params.description:
Set to false to not move the widget to
 the left if there is insufficient space on the right.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is removed.

return.description: Returns $widget.

classitems.description: Expand the widget. Width is set to the current grid width.
classitems.name: expand_widget

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget.

params.name: size_x
params.description: The number of cols that will occupy the widget.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The number of rows that will occupy the widget.

params.name: col
params.description: The column to resize the widget from.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is expanded.

return.description: Returns $widget.

classitems.description: Collapse the widget to it's pre-expanded size
classitems.name: collapse_widget

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is collapsed.

return.description: Returns $widget.

classitems.description: Fit the size of a widget to its content (best guess)
classitems.name: fit_to_content

params.name: $widget
params.description: $widget The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement

params.name: max_cols
params.description: max number of columns a widget can take up

params.name: max_rows
params.description: max number of rows a widget can take up

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is fit to content.

return.description: Returns $widget.

classitems.description: Centers widgets in grid
classitems.name: center_widgets

classitems.description: Change the dimensions of widgets.
classitems.name: resize_widget_dimensions

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: widget_margins
props.description:
Margin between widgets.
    The first index for the horizontal margin (left, right) and
    the second for the vertical margin (top, bottom).

props.name: widget_base_dimensions
props.description:
Base widget dimensions
    in pixels. The first index for the width and the second for the
    height.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Mutate widget dimensions and position in the grid map.
classitems.name: mutate_widget_in_gridmap

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement
 representing the widget to mutate.

params.name: wgd
params.description: Current widget grid data (col, row, size_x, size_y).

params.name: new_wgd
params.description: New widget grid data.

return.description: Returns instance of gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Move down widgets in cells represented by the arguments col, row, size_x,
size_y
classitems.name: empty_cells

params.name: col
params.description: The column where the group of cells begin.

params.name: row
params.description: The row where the group of cells begin.

params.name: size_x
params.description:
The number of columns that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: size_y
params.description:
The number of rows that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: $exclude
params.description: Exclude widgets from being moved.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Move up widgets below cells represented by the arguments col, row, size_x,
size_y.
classitems.name: remove_empty_cells

params.name: col
params.description: The column where the group of cells begin.

params.name: row
params.description: The row where the group of cells begin.

params.name: size_x
params.description:
The number of columns that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: size_y
params.description:
The number of rows that the group of cells
occupy.

params.name: exclude
params.description: Exclude widgets from being moved.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Get the most left column below to add a new widget.
classitems.name: next_position

params.name: size_x
params.description: The nº of rows the widget occupies horizontally.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The nº of columns the widget occupies vertically.

return.description:
Returns a grid coords object representing the future
 widget coords.

classitems.description: Remove a widget from the grid.
classitems.name: remove_widget

params.name: el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement you want to remove.

params.name: silent
params.description:
If true, widgets below the removed one
will not move up. If a Function is passed it will be used as callback.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed when the widget is removed.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Remove all widgets from the grid.
classitems.name: remove_all_widgets

params.name: callback
params.description: Function executed for each widget removed.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Returns a serialized array of the widgets in the grid.
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
The collection of jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElements you want to serialize. If no argument is passed all widgets
 will be serialized.

return.description:
Returns an Array of Objects with the data specified in
 the serialize_params option.

classitems.description:
Returns a serialized array of the widgets that have changed their
 position.
classitems.name: serialize_changed

return.description:
Returns an Array of Objects with the data specified in
 the serialize_params option.

classitems.description: Convert widgets from DOM elements to "widget grid data" Objects.
classitems.name: dom_to_coords

params.name: $widget
params.description: The widget to be converted.

classitems.description:
Creates the grid coords object representing the widget an add it to the
mapped array of positions.
classitems.name: register_widget

params.name: $el
params.description:
jQuery wrapped HTMLElement representing
 the widget, or an "widget grid data" Object with (col, row, el ...).

return.description:
Returns true if the widget final position is different
 than the original.

classitems.description:
Update in the mapped array of positions the value of cells represented by
the grid coords object passed in the `grid_data` param.

params.name: grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

params.name: value
params.description:
Pass `false` or the jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElement, depends if you want to delete an existing position or add
 a new one.

classitems.name: update_widget_position

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Update the width and height for a widgets coordinate data.

params.name: $widget
params.description: The widget to update.

params.name: width
params.description: The new width for this widget.

params.name: height
params.description: The new height for this widget.

classitems.name: update_widget_dimensions

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Update dimensions for all widgets in the grid.
classitems.name: update_widgets_dimensions

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Remove a widget from the mapped array of positions.

params.name: grid_data

The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Add a widget to the mapped array of positions.

params.name: grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

params.name: value
params.description:
The value to set in the specified
 position .

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Executes the callbacks passed as arguments when a column begins to be
overlapped or stops being overlapped.

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new column
 begins to be overlapped. The column is passed as first argument.

params.name: stop_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a column stops
 being overlapped. The column is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: on_overlapped_column_change

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Executes the callbacks passed as arguments when a row starts to be
overlapped or stops being overlapped.

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new row begins
 to be overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

params.name: end_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a row stops being
 overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: on_overlapped_row_change

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Sets the current position of the player
classitems.name: set_player

classitems.description:
See which of the widgets in the $widgets param collection can go to
a upper row and which not.
classitems.name: widgets_contraints

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
A jQuery wrapped collection of
HTMLElements.

return.description:
Returns a literal Object with two keys: `can_go_up` &
`can_not_go_up`. Each contains a set of HTMLElements.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in descending way.

Depreciated.
classitems.name: manage_movements

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
A jQuery collection of HTMLElements
 representing the widgets you want to move.

params.name: to_col
params.description: The column to which we want to move the widgets.

params.name: to_row
params.description: The row to which we want to move the widgets.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

Determines if there is a widget in the row and col given. Or if the

params.name: col_or_el

A jQuery wrapped collection of
HTMLElements.

params.name: row
params.description: The column to which we want to move the widgets.

return.description: Returns true or false.

classitems.description:
Determines if the widget that is being dragged is currently over the row
and col given.

return.description: Returns true or false.

classitems.description: Determines if the cell represented by col and row params is empty.

params.description: The row to check.

return.description: Returns true or false.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to check.

return.description: Returns true or false.

classitems.description: Determines if there is a widget in the cell represented by col/row params.

params.name: col

params.name: row

return.description:
Returns false if there is no widget,
else returns the jQuery HTMLElement

classitems.description:
Determines if widget is supposed to be static.
WARNING: as of 0.6.6 this feature is buggy when
used with resizable widgets, as resizing widgets
above and below a static widgit can cause it to move.
This feature is considered experimental at this time
classitems.name: is_static

params.name: col
params.description: The column to check.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to check.

return.description:
Returns true if widget exists and has static class,
else returns false

classitems.description:
Determines if there is a widget in the cell represented by col/row
params and if this is under the widget that is being dragged.

params.name: col
params.description: The column to check.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to check.

return.description: Returns true or false.

Get widgets overlapping with the player or with the object passed
representing the grid cells.

return.description: Returns a jQuery collection of HTMLElements

The column to which we want to move the
 placeholder.

The row to which we want to move the

classitems.description: Determines whether the player can move to a position above.
classitems.name: can_go_player_up

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The actual grid coords object of the
 player.

If the player can be moved to an upper row

classitems.description: Determines whether a widget can move to a position above.
classitems.name: can_go_widget_up

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The actual grid coords object of the
 widget we want to check.

return.description:
If the widget can be moved to an upper row
 returns the row number, else returns false.

classitems.description:
Search a valid row for the widget represented by `widget_grid_data' in
the `upper_rows` array. Iteration starts from row specified in `min_row`.
classitems.name: get_valid_rows

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The actual grid coords object of the
 player.

params.name: upper_rows
params.description:
An array with columns as index and arrays
 of valid rows as values.

params.name: min_row
params.description: The upper row from which the iteration will start.

return.description:
Returns the upper row valid from the `upper_rows`
 for the widget in question.

classitems.description: Get widgets overlapping with the player.

return.description: Returns a jQuery collection of HTMLElements.

classitems.description:
Move a widget to a specific row and column.
If the widget has widgets below, all of these widgets will be moved also
classitems.name: move_widget

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement of the
widget is going to be moved.

params.name: new_col
params.description: the column number to be set in widget

params.name: new_row
params.description: the row number to be set in widget

params.name: callback
params.description: is called when whole process is done.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Move a widget to a specific row. The cell or cells must be empty.
If the widget has widgets below, all of these widgets will be moved also
if they can.
classitems.name: move_widget_to

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement of the
widget is going to be moved.

params.name: row
params.description: - row to move the widget to

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Move up the specified widget and all below it.
classitems.name: move_widget_up

params.name: $widget
params.description: The widget you want to move.

params.name: y_units
params.description: The number of cells that the widget has to move.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Move down the specified widget and all below it.
classitems.name: move_widget_down

params.name: $widget
params.description:
The jQuery object representing the widget
 you want to move.

params.name: y_units
params.description: The number of cells that the widget has to move.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Check if the widget can move to the specified row, else returns the
upper row possible.
classitems.name: can_go_up_to_row

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The current grid coords object of the
 widget.

params.name: col
params.description: The target column.

params.name: row
params.description: The target row.

return.description:
Returns the row number if the widget can move
 to the target position, else returns false.

classitems.description: Get widgets below a widget.
classitems.name: widgets_below

params.name: $el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement.

return.description: A jQuery collection of HTMLElements.

classitems.description: Update the array of mapped positions with the new player position.
classitems.name: set_cells_player_occupies

params.name: col
params.description: The new player col.

params.name: col
params.description: The new player row.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Remove from the array of mapped positions the reference to the player.
classitems.name: empty_cells_player_occupies

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Check if it's possible to move a widget to a specific col/row. It takes
into account the dimensions (`size_y` and `size_x` attrs. of the grid
 coords object) the widget occupies.
classitems.name: can_move_to

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object that represents
 the widget.

params.name: col
params.description: The col to check.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to check.

return.description: Returns true if all cells are empty, else return false.

classitems.description:
Given the leftmost column returns all columns that are overlapping
 with the player.
classitems.name: get_targeted_columns

params.name: from_col
params.description: The leftmost column.

return.description: Returns an array with column numbers.

classitems.description: Given the upper row returns all rows that are overlapping with the player.
classitems.name: get_targeted_rows

params.name: from_row
params.description: The upper row.

return.description: Returns an array with row numbers.

classitems.description: Get all columns and rows that a widget occupies.
classitems.name: get_cells_occupied

params.name: el_grid_data
params.description: The grid coords object of the widget.

return.description: Returns an object like `{ cols: [], rows: []}`.

classitems.description:
Iterate over the cells occupied by a widget executing a function for
each one.
classitems.name:
for_each_cell_occupied
 widget.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each column
 iteration. Column and row are passed as arguments.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Iterate over the columns occupied by a widget executing a function for
each one.
classitems.name: for_each_column_occupied

params.name: el_grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object that represents
 the widget.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each column
 iteration. The column number is passed as first argument.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Iterate over the rows occupied by a widget executing a function for
each one.
classitems.name: for_each_row_occupied

params.name: el_grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object that represents
 the widget.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each column
 iteration. The row number is passed as first argument.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Traverse a series of widgets

params.name: type
params.description: - currently supported 'for_each'

params.name: direction
params.description:
- The direction to traverse.  Supports 'above' and 'below'
   NOTE: the directions are based on the layout in the grid above is toward the top
   and below is toward the bottom. EG opposite direction of the row numbers

params.name: col
params.description: - column to traverse

params.name: row
params.description: - starting row in the column

params.name: callback
params.description: - a function that will be called for every widget found

classitems.description: Iterate over each widget above the column and row specified.
classitems.name: for_each_widget_above

params.name: col
params.description: The column to start iterating.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to start iterating.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each widget
 iteration. The value of `this` inside the function is the jQuery
 wrapped HTMLElement.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Iterate over each widget below the column and row specified.
classitems.name: for_each_widget_below

params.name: col
params.description: The column to start iterating.

params.name: row
params.description: The row to start iterating.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function to execute on each widget
 iteration. The value of `this` inside the function is the jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElement.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Returns the highest occupied cell in the grid.
classitems.name: get_highest_occupied_cell

return.description: Returns an object with `col` and `row` numbers.

classitems.description: return the widgets what exist within the given range of grid cells

params.name: col1
params.description: - col of upper left search

params.name: row1
params.description: - row of upper left search

params.name: col2
params.description: - col of lower right search

params.name: row2
params.description: - row of lower rigth search

return.description: - a collection of the cells within the range

classitems.description: return any widget which is located at the given coordinates

params.name: col
params.description: - col to search at

params.name: row
params.description: - row to search at

return.description: - a collection of any widgets found.

classitems.description:
gets the list of widgets in either the row or the col passed in_loop
 Not sure if this makes sense for the API or what the use case is,
  but I'm documenting it as it exists.

params.name: col
params.description: - a col to search for widgets from

params.name: row
params.description: - a row to search for widgets from

return.description:
- a collection of the widgets in either
the row or the col passed in.

classitems.deprecationMessage:
- if you want to search for widgets in a cell or a range
look at get_widgets_in_range and get_widgets_at_cell

classitems.description: Set the current height of the parent grid.
classitems.name: set_dom_grid_height

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Set the current width of the parent grid.
classitems.name: set_dom_grid_width

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Checks if this grid is responsive.
autogenerate_stylesheet be true, the widget base width should be auto, and there must be a max_cols set.
Generates the width of the grid columns based on the width of the window.

Changes the minimum width of a widget based on the width of the window and the number of cols that can
fit in it.
Switches between collapsed widgets the span the full width when the responsive_breakpoint is triggered.
It generates the necessary styles to position the widgets.
classitems.name: generate_stylesheet

params.name: opts
params.description: - set of gridster config options to generate stylessheets based on

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Injects the given CSS as string to the head of the document.
classitems.name: add_style_tag

params.name: css
params.description: The styles to apply.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Remove the style tag with the associated id from the head of the document
classitems.name: remove_style_tag

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Generates a faux grid to collide with it when a widget is dragged and
detect row or column that we want to go.
classitems.name: generate_faux_grid

params.name: rows
params.description: Number of columns.

params.name: cols
params.description: Number of rows.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Add cell to the faux grid.
classitems.name: add_faux_cell

params.name: row
params.description: The row for the new faux cell.

params.name: col
params.description: The col for the new faux cell.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Add rows to the faux grid.
classitems.name: add_faux_rows

params.name: rows
params.description: The number of rows you want to add to the faux grid.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Add cols to the faux grid.
classitems.name: add_faux_cols

params.name: cols
params.description: The number of cols you want to add to the faux grid.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description:
Recalculates the offsets for the faux grid. You need to use it when
the browser is resized.
classitems.name: recalculate_faux_grid

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Resize dimensions of widgets in grid based on given options
classitems.name: resize_widget_dimensions

classitems.description: Get all widgets in the DOM and register them.
classitems.name: get_widgets_from_DOM

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Helper function used to set the current number of columns in the grid

Calculate columns and rows to be set based on the configuration
 parameters, grid dimensions, etc ...
classitems.name: generate_grid_and_stylesheet

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.

classitems.description: Destroy this gridster by removing any sign of its presence, making it easy to avoid memory leaks
classitems.name: destroy

params.name: remove
params.description: If true, remove gridster from DOM.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster class.
